annotations.paragraph: Re “Trump Is Going Too Far in Amassing His Power, Most Voters in Poll Say” (front page, April 26):
annotations.reason: This paragraph introduces a specific article or poll related to Trump's actions, contributing context to the main premise.

annotations.paragraph: The New York Times/Siena College poll on President Trump’s job performance is a powerful testament to his growing unpopularity — a statement of Americans’ overall disapproval of the president’s agenda and his conduct in virtually every category in the survey, notably his high-profile campaign issues regarding the economy, immigration and the structure of the federal government.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides specific information about a poll related to Trump's job performance, which is relevant to the headline.

annotations.paragraph: In general, voters seem to debunk the administration’s argument that this is what the country voted for.
annotations.reason: This paragraph offers a generalization about voter sentiment, which is relevant to the discussion of Trump's performance.
